<misra_rule>
MISRA C 2023 Rule 2.1 is: A project shall not contain unreachable code.

</misra_rule>
<response format>
Provide your answer with these fields.
- is_rule_violated: whether the rule is violated or not (true/false),
- scenario: a specific violation scenario.
</response format>
<target_code>
Here is the code of OS_PthreadTaskEntry:
```c
static void *OS_PthreadTaskEntry(void *arg)
{
    OS_VoidPtrValueWrapper_t local_arg;

    /* cppcheck-suppress unreadVariable // intentional use of other union member */
    local_arg.opaque_arg = arg;
    OS_TaskEntryPoint(local_arg.id); /* Never returns */

    return NULL;
}
```
</target_code>
<additional code>Here are the definitions of symbols that are close to the target function OS_PthreadTaskEntry:
void OS_TaskExit()
{
    osal_id_t         task_id;
    OS_object_token_t token;

    task_id = OS_TaskGetId_Impl();
    if (OS_ObjectIdGetById(OS_LOCK_MODE_GLOBAL, LOCAL_OBJID_TYPE, task_id, &token) == OS_SUCCESS)
    {
        OS_TaskDetach_Impl(&token);

        /* Complete the operation via the common routine */
        OS_ObjectIdFinalizeDelete(OS_SUCCESS, &token);
    }

    /* call the implementation */
    OS_TaskExit_Impl();

    /* Impl function never returns */
}
</additional code>
<target_code>
Here is the code fragment that you need to analyze:
```c
OS_TaskExit_Impl();
```
Focus on the above code fragment and judge whether it violates the rule 2.1 or not.
</target_code>
scenario: The code contains statements that cannot be reached at run-time. In OS_PthreadTaskEntry the call OS_TaskEntryPoint(local_arg.id) is documented as “Never returns”, therefore the subsequent statement return NULL; is unreachable. Likewise, the fragment OS_TaskExit_Impl(); is documented as non‑returning so any code placed after that call would be unreachable. This situation violates MISRA C 2023 Rule 2.1 (no unreachable code).
